title: Zip World Grand Tour
tagline: Every Zip World experience in one epic trip
suitableFor: Families and adventurous friends who enjoy outdoor activities and aren't afraid of heights. Children must meet the minimum age and weight requirements for each activity.
notSuitableFor: Individuals with severe vertigo, heart conditions, or mobility limitations. Those who prefer leisurely sightseeing or have very young children (under 3).

stops.title: Velocity 2 Zip Line
stops.description: Experience the thrill of flying over Penrhyn Quarry on the world's fastest zip line. Expect stunning views and an adrenaline rush.

wetAlt.title: Zip World Caverns
wetAlt.description: Explore a network of underground zip lines and rope bridges in a disused slate mine. It's sheltered from the elements.

budgetAlt.title: Llyn Ogwen Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around Llyn Ogwen lake, taking in the breathtaking mountain views. Free parking available.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary cafe in Llanberis known for its hearty portions and climber-friendly atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Padarn
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch with views of the lake and Dolbadarn Castle.

stops.title: Bounce Below
stops.description: Jump and play on giant trampolines suspended in a vast underground cavern. A unique and fun experience for all ages.

wetAlt.title: Underground Adventure
wetAlt.description: Explore the mine deeper with an expert guide.

budgetAlt.title: Blaenau Ffestiniog Railway Museum
budgetAlt.description: Explore the history of slate mining at this local museum

stops.title: Treks Bunkhouse
stops.description: A comfortable bunkhouse in Ffestiniog, ideal for groups and adventure enthusiasts.

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan) - Camping
budgetAlt.description: Camping at the foot of Snowdon, offering basic facilities and stunning views.

stops.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
stops.description: Ride the UK's only alpine coaster, winding through the forest on a thrilling toboggan run.

wetAlt.title: Tree Top Adventures
wetAlt.description: Get high up in the trees and tackle a series of obstacles and zip lines in a sheltered forest canopy.

budgetAlt.title: Swallow Falls Walk
budgetAlt.description: A scenic walk to a beautiful waterfall near Betws-y-Coed. Admission fee applies.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Gwydir Forest
budgetAlt.description: Find a secluded spot for a picnic surrounded by nature.

stops.title: Gorge Walking
stops.description: Explore a stunning gorge by scrambling over rocks, wading through pools, and jumping into waterfalls.

wetAlt.title: National White Water Centre
wetAlt.description: Watch expert kayakers and canoeists tackle the rapids.

budgetAlt.title: Llyn Tegid (Bala Lake) walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a relaxing walk around the lake. The largest natural lake in Wales.

stops.title: Bala Backpackers
stops.description: Budget-friendly hostel in Bala, with a sociable atmosphere and shared facilities.

budgetAlt.title: Bala Backpackers - Dorm Room
budgetAlt.description: Save money by booking a bed in a shared dormitory.

stops.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur
stops.description: Ride the family-friendly MinorTaur trail at Coed y Brenin Forest Park, suitable for all ages and abilities.

wetAlt.title: Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore the visitor center, learn about the forest, and enjoy a coffee in the cafe.

budgetAlt.title: Walking trails at Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Explore the marked trails at Coed y Brenin

stops.title: Coed y Brenin Cafe
stops.description: A cafe located at Coed y Brenin Forest Park visitor center.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at a scenic spot
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch with views of the lake and mountains.

stops.title: Downhill MTB - Antur Stiniog
stops.description: Take the uplift and blast down one of Antur Stiniog's various downhill MTB trails. Something for all abilities.

wetAlt.title: Slate Caverns Exploration
wetAlt.description: Visit the Llechwedd Deep Mine Tour, an immersive journey into the history of slate mining.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Blaenau Ffestiniog
budgetAlt.description: Take a stroll around the town and visit the local shops and cafes.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Snowdonia weather can be unpredictable. Be prepared for rain, wind, and sunshine, even in summer. Check the forecast before you go and pack accordingly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially during peak season (summer holidays and weekends). Allow extra time for travel, especially around popular destinations like Llanberis and Betws-y-Coed. Parking can be limited, so arrive early or use park-and-ride facilities where available.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for Zip World activities, especially during peak season. Accommodation should also be booked well in advance to avoid disappointment. Gorge Walking requires booking through an operator.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for this trip. Some activities involve walking, climbing, and scrambling. Be sure to check the difficulty rating and suitability of each activity before booking.
